title: [Large-Scale] Constraint-Induced Approach (CIA) Instructional Design for Physical Education Motivation

context.prior_knowledge: Physical education theory, foundational teaching methods, and basic concepts of Self-Determination Theory (SDT)
context.additional_context: A process for pre-service teachers to acquire CLA-based lesson design and implementation methods that support learners' autonomy, competence, and relatedness in physical education classes

learning_goals: Applying CLAâ€™s nonlinear educational principles, learners can propose three or more instructional strategies that fulfill psychological needs (autonomy, competence, relatedness) in physical education lesson design

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
